subject: p15758946
Impression: AP chest compared to : Moderately severe pulmonary edema which developed on has substantially improved. Only a small residual remains, but there is still moderate left and small right pleural effusion. The heart is normal size, and mediastinal veins are no longer dilated. ET tube, left subclavian infusion port, right internal jugular line are in standard placements. Nasogastric tube would need to be advanced 5 cm to move all the side ports into the stomach. No pneumothorax.
